channel.title: Builds on CozyKeys
channel.description: Recent content in Builds on CozyKeys

item.title: First Hand-Wired Bloomer
item.description: First Handwired Bloomer This keyboard was previously named the Atreus87/Ergo87 Previewing the Layout Before building the keyboard, I put some switches and keycaps on it to make sure the layout is comfortable. Here’s another angle showing the thumb key profiles. I chose to go with GMK Iris as it has R0 and R5 profiles in the top and bottom row. My hope was that this would help the the function keys stand out a bit from the number keys, and it does.

item.title: First Handwired Speedo
item.description: First Handwired Speedo This build log documents the process I went through in creating the first, functional Speedo keyboard. It is rather long so a table of contents is provided to make finding a specific step a bit easier. Table of Contents 2018/02/16 Creating the Thumb Clusters 2018/02/23 Rev1 Comes to an End Oops Solution Next Steps 2018/02/25 Order is in for Rev2 2018/02/26 Deciding on Parts The Decision A Close Second 2018/03/07 The parts arrived!

item.title: First Iris Build
item.description: First Iris Build Wednesday, Jan 24, 2018 Wednesday 01/24/2018 TL;DR A few more parts arrived but I’m still waiting on the case. Notes Today I got back from Hawaii and a few other parts arrived: Keycaps from PimpMyKeyboard Strip LED 470 Ohm resistors Still waiting on the case pieces which should come within the next few business days. Hopefully I’ll get started on the build this weekend.

item.title: Heroes of the Storm Advantage2
item.description: Heroes of the Storm Advantage2 Tuesday, Jul 18, 2017 Introduction This post will document my adventure of taking my favorite keyboard and modifying it to make it my own. If you aren’t interested in reading about the process, here is the final product: Background A few years ago I bought my first mechanical keyboard; it was a Coolermaster CM Storm with cherry MX blue switches and I instantly loved it.
